data.title: The Adventures of Prince Achmed
data.meta_description: The Adventures of Prince Achmed (1926) directed by Lotte Reiniger.
data.text:
Film ThreatPhil Hall

That The Adventures of Prince Achmed still survives is a work of wonder equivalent to any rare treasure which Aladdin could rub out of his lamp.

Antagony & EcstasyTim Brayton

More than eighty years later...it still looks like nothing you've ever seen.

Combustible CelluloidJeffrey M. Anderson

The Adventures of Prince Achmed deserves to be a landmark. And it would be if it were better known.

TV GuideTV Guide Staff

German filmmaker Lotte Reiniger's ground-breaking, silent, animated fantasy feature used cut-out paper silhouettes to tell a tale that combines pieces of several stories from The Arabian Nights: Tales from a Thousand and One Nights.

Boston GlobeGlobe Staff

The picture Is fully as fantastic and as entrancing as the characters about whom the story revolves.

New York TimesMordaunt Hall

It may not be exactly new to perceive silhouette figures on the screen, but it is quite another matter as they are offered here.

San Francisco ExaminerWesley Morris

A rapturous animated kaleidoscope with a more abstracted visage of the 1001 Arabians Nights tale than you could dream.

Hartford CourantWalter Brown

Certainly there is more to appeal to an active young imagination, (even like my own) in the "acting" of a convincing silhouette hero in a fairy-story than there is in the undeniably flesh-and-blood attributes of impersonation of a player.
